title: What is the brutal truth about high school friendships? - Quora

response.answer_text: They don’t last forever. They may, but they might as well not. If I’m being honest, out of the people I was in the same year with in high school, I talk to precisely two of them. Out of like.. 50+ people. Okay, three people tops, and I’d consider them friends. Everyone else… nah. But then, it’s not like we got along that well in school, either. Out of the people I knew while in high school but didn’t go to school together with, I’m friends with 6 out of 10+. Sure, if I met some of them we’d catch up and chat and have a good time.. but we don’t seek out each others company. It’s a bit of a shame, but then that’s life. You drift apart and that’s okay. You meet new people. However, you will meet more people of like mind when you attend university. I still hang out with my coursemates and I consider them friends for life, on par with a friend I met in kindergarten and still consider one of my closest friends. That’s how highly I value those connections; way higher than any high school era friendship. Maybe it’s because high school was merely a pit stop for me, it wasn’t anything special to write home about but university was. But don’t expect them to last until death. It’s a rare thing.

They are often only possible in the specific environment of high school. This means the friendship can only survive in school. Worse, some of these friendships are only a result of having no better option. Meaning that sports jock your friends with in art, will immediately ditch you for his actual friends in gym. And the final one, is that most won’t last. High schooler’s are at a point in their lives where they change the most which makes good friends better, and everyone one else a stranger or enemy.
